lead_paragraph: U.S. bankruptcy law allows the California city of Stockton to cut pension benefits because it can treat its obligations to the public retirement fund like other debts, a federal judge said in a ruling that could help clarify who gets paid first by financially strapped cities around the nation — pension funds or creditors.

headline.main: Ruling Lets Bankrupt City Cut Pension Benefits
headline.print_headline: Ruling Lets Bankrupt City Cut Pension Benefits
